Package Draughts

Class Piece

java.lang.Object
Draughts.Point
Draughts.Piece
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Piece
extends Draughts.Point
implements java.io.Serializable
Class identifies pieces on a draughts board. There are 12 pieces per player. It inherits its x and y value from the "Point" class. It implements serializable so that it can be written to a file.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Piece

      public Piece​(int x, int y, java.lang.String colour, boolean isKing, boolean isCaptured, boolean hasValidMove)
      Creates a piece with the given variables. It should contain information for all variables.
      Parameters:
      x - is the x value of the piece.
      y - is the y value of the piece.
      colour - is the colour of the piece. Is only black or brown.
      isKing - determines whether a piece is a king.
      isCaptured - determines whether a piece is captured.
      hasValidMove - determines whether a piece has a valid move.

      public boolean isKing()

      Returns:
      true or false for if a piece is a king.

    • setKing

      public void setKing​(boolean king)

      Parameters:

    • setCaptured

      public void setCaptured​(boolean isCaptured, java.util.ArrayList<Piece> allPieces)
      Sets whether a piece is captured. If a piece is captured it's removed from the "allPieces" ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      isCaptured - is set either true or false.
      allPieces - is used to remove the piece from the ArrayList.

    • isHasValidMove

      public boolean isHasValidMove()

      Parameters:

    • getPiece

      public static Piece getPiece​(int x, int y, java.util.ArrayList<Piece> allPieces)
      Is used to get a piece from the ArrayList allPieces to get the x and y value of the piece from where the player clicks.
      Parameters:
      x - is the x value of where the player clicked.
      y - is the y value of where the player clicked.
      allPieces - is the ArrayList which contains all pieces and is searched.
      Returns:
      the piece whos x and y values match the selected area. It is then moved to where the mouse is dragged.

    • move

      public void move​(int x, int y, java.util.ArrayList<Piece> allPieces, java.util.ArrayList<Draughts.Player> allPlayers)
      Is a method to move the piece once the mouse is released. It also verifies whether a piece has reached a valid place to be kinged and if it is calls a method to do so.
      Parameters:
      x - is the x value of the place the mouse is released.
      y - is the y value of the place the mouse is released.
      allPieces - is the ArrayList which contains all pieces and is searched.
      allPlayers - is the ArrayList which contains all players and is searched.

    • removePiece

      public static void removePiece​(Piece p, java.util.ArrayList<Piece> allPieces)
      Removes the piece if it is taken.
      Parameters:
      p - is the piece which is being removed.
      allPieces - is the ArrayList which contains all pieces and is searched.

    • paintKing
